text_excerpt: HK Disney is much smaller and therefore missing the key attractions we are used to.
But the biggest thing missing is the food. Don't come here expecting to eat US food anywhere.

the location was right for the night time light parade.

We got lucky on the timing.

whilst my wife liked the Peter Pan ride and Its Small World Ride

the shops, all though all very similar were not in my mind particulary overpriced as you wouldn`t expect them to be cheap.
Overall, a great experience but possibly only if you don`t mind queuing.

Sometimes, it is possible to get multiple Fastpasses for the different attractions at over lapping times. Using this method, we did some of the busiest attractions (Big Thunder Mountain, Space Mountain, Buzz Lightyear's Lazer Blast, Star Tours) within a couple of hours.
By 11am, the return time for Big Thunder Mountain was 18:00... and that often means you can't get another Fastpass until after that time!

Everyone is super nice and friendly and helpful, they all help make the Disney magic real.
There are also many extra things on offer and one of these was the character breakfast at the Garden Plaze restaurant.

those that want pictures and collect the character autographs as there are characters dotted around the park which always have a decent sized queue, and if you are chasing the character autographs there is a possibility of having wasted time queuing for one when they would appear at your breakfast.
The breakfast is a buffet and has a huge variety of food from cooked english to continental and it was was all very nice.
Now for those that stay in the Disney hotels you get to enter early into the park at 8.30am (general public are not admitted till 10am as of Dec 2017)
at least for us when we were there it only gave you partial access to Fantasyland (also not all rides are open)
this enables the eager beavers in the morning to rush to the princess's hut (amongst other things too) to queue early and see their princess much quicker

Speaking to the staff that work there they said they do not know who will be there from one day to the next, however i am sure they know who will be there in the morning as there is a notice board when you get there at 8.30am telling who is there and who will come in the afternoon

What would be nice is before you end up waking up super early and rushing off out of your hotel, to get to the park super early, it would be nice if in the morning (even perhaps via the app) to say which princess's were going to be present for the coming day at the hotels

The cost of everything it what you would expect in a Disney park, so all the gift shops down main street will be a little pricy some better than others.

We did find it irritating that some other guests didn't have similar etiquette with queing. Felt unfair waiting for a while then having guests push through but this is just a culture thing, didn't let this ruin our fab time.
As with most Disney breaks it's important to pace yourself (I can admit I am terrible at this) because these parks are so overwhelming and fast paced it really takes it out of you.
Thank you for having us and we will definitely be returning in the future again.

I ended up carrying all the heavy loads around on my back. Imagine bringing those around for 11 straight hours!
It was such a hurtful treat from the staff at Disneyland having such a mindless service to visitors like us.

download the Disneyland App
book Fast Passes from your phone rather than having to walk to the ride and then come back at a certain time
it allows you to have multiple Fast Passes at a time and let's you know when you are eligible to book your next one
it let's you connect and keep all of your pictures in one place
let's you book food or restaurant reservations
gives you wait times for all of the rides for both Disney and California Adventure
tells you where characters are appearing and at what times
You can also keep you tickets on your phone so you don't have to worry about paper tickets.

I've been to Disney World multiple times and it's always been a great experience.
I have to say I was very disappointed with the experience.
My first complaint would be the number of rides that were closed during our visit.
Disney will often release ride closures on very short notice.
This was especially aggravating as these were the 2 rides that were different than Disney World that we wanted to experience.
In addition to the ride closures we also experienced multiple unexpected temporary ride closures.
We were in line 3 times where the ride broke down and they had to shut the rides down temporarily.
Even the monorail was broken when we tried to ride that.
The crowds were also a problem. We went during what was expected to be one of the slowest weeks of the year for the park and it was still quite crowded.
Lines were often long for the attractions.
Perhaps we were lucky on our previous trips to Disney World but we never experienced these problems before
In the future we'll be sticking to the Florida parks.

This is our third time going to Disneyland and it was just as enjoyable as our last.
We have gone for five full days every time that we visit, and have never ran out of things to do between Disneyland park and the California Adventure Park.
Even though it was spring break, the park was much less crowded than we expected and we were able to see everything that we wanted to see!
did not have to wait any more than 45 minutes in any of the single lines.
Try to get there before the park officially opens.
Main Street opens half an hour before the rest of the park, and you can spend some of the time browsing shops
or having a quick bite to eat while waiting
some attractions at Disneyland park with the biggest line ups are Indiana Jones, Splash Mountain, Space Mountain, the Matterhorn and Big Thunder Mountain
Fastpass is a great system that is available at a few of the biggest attractions in Disneyland and California Adventure park.
When you do return, you're admitted into a separate entrance that usually has no more than a 10 15 minute wait
even when the Standby line can be over an hour and a half!
The Golden Horseshoe in Frontierland has 15 minute shows than run every hour in the afternoon
and it is a fun place to grab a snack and get out of the sun for a while.
Other show to watch is the Tiki Room in Adventureland (Nice and Air conditioned
they sell pineapple dole whip and floats right outside
we enjoy the air conditioning so much that we still go every time!
Other good options for the afternoon are the Mark Twain Riverboat or the Pirate's Lair in Frontierland
Main Street attractions (they have street cars you can ride on and a few shows to see as well
Pirates of the Caribbean and the Haunted Mansion are good as well for the afternoon, because these attractions hold so many people at one time that even if the line is long, it goes really fast.
The line also seems to go much faster after the park closes too.
if there is a ride that is always lined up (like the Matterhorn or Space Mountain), you can get in line right before the park closes, and as long as you're in line before then you will still get on.
Stay clear of it in the afternoon! This place is always packed, and since the rides do not hold many people you can be waiting for over 2 hours for some of the attractions.
Also, the lines can be tick you. They may not look long, when in reality the wind many times and go through tunnels.
So make sure you check the sign at the front of the attraction for the estimated wait time.
We were also very pleased with the food selection this time (has improved a lot since the last time we visited).
Some of our favourites were the shrimp salad stuffed potato at the Harbor Galley
the Clam Chowder that can be found around the park, and the Hungry Bear Restaurant in Critter Country.
If your looking for pizza or pasta, go to Red Rocket's Pizza Port in Tomorrowland.
If you want finer dining, try the Blue Bayou.
We finally treated ourselves to this restaurant and it became the highlight of our trip.
The restaurant sits in the Pirates of the Carribean restaurant, so you get to watch the boats go by as you eat.
Also, the food was great and the service was awesome!
remember that Disneyland is not a park for thrill rides, but for it's charm and experience, you will have a great time!
I truly believe that Disneyland is for everyone!

text_excerpt: This was our third visit to Disneyland Paris
our first over the christmas period

you are going to have to queue as this is a fantastic place

scan the entry tickets
There are long queues to meet the princesses and characters.
this was around 3 4 hours minimum so get there as early as possible and start queuing.
I recommend Mickey Caf   in the Disney Village to meet the characters.
we saw Minnie, Mickey, Pluto, Goofy and Tigger. Each of them signed our books and let us have a photo.

The princesses spent time talking to my daughters and again each of them signed their books and let us have a photo.
The food was lovely in the Plaza Gardens (buffet)
only 1 toliet meant a 10 minute wait!
Given that queues for princesses in the park were averaging around 2 hours, I feel this was good value and a memorable experience (and no queuing in the cold for hours!).
I recommend booking Mickey Caf     The Auberge well in advance before you leave the UK.
We will definitely come again but in the summer.
Although it is beautiful at christmas, it is very cold ( 2 degrees on 2 of the days so dress as you would for Ski ing!)
but I would still recommend coming at this time of year at least once just to experience the magic.

I have just written a review of the Disneyland Paris Studios which seems to be where all the money is going at the moment from a development point of view.
Anyone visiting for the first time would not notice the cut backs on shows and parades since the last time we visited.
Sadly missing this year was the night time illuminated parade which always came before the fireworks
replaced with a rather spectacular effects show projected on to the castle which appealed to our older children but might have been lost on some of the younger ones.
Also very obvious in its absence was the extraordinary Tarzan show which was a shame and nothing replaced it from what we could see.
Likewise with the Lion King show which used to happen daily in Videopolis and was replaced this year by touring brass bands, not quite the same when you are having your pizza lunch.
On the subject of food, its expensive but serves the purpose.

would suggest to make proper use of maps
the timings mentioned on it for the rides so that you don   t miss any
being Sunday the wait time was not more than 15     20 mins.
But one small disappointment for us was the food coz being an Indian we would prefer Asian or Indian meal but we couldn   t found any options other than European food
Also, the Indian restaurants that were shown on map were all shut and there was no update regarding the same coz it was far and we had to search walking which was very time consuming.
But at the end the very famous Disney Fireworks (09:00 pm) a not to be missed stuff, is a treat to the eyes and it makes you forget the entire day   s tiredness.
Over all experience was wonderful and would really suggest to visit once in your life.
But for hard core rides & coaster lovers I guess this place won   t work for u guys.
